com.complexible.stardog.icv.api
Interface ICVConnection

All Superinterfaces:
com.complexible.common.base.Closeable, Connection, ICValidator
public interface ICVConnection
extends Connection, ICValidator

Interface to merge the SNARL Connection API with the standard IC validator so validation can be performed against a connection.

Since:
0.7
Version:
0.7
Author:
Michael Grove

Method Summary
 IO addConstraints()
          Return an IO which can add a constraint ontology specified in RDF to the database.
 StardogExplainer explain(Constraint... theConstraints)
          Returns an explainer that can be used to explain the violation for given constraints.
 IO removeConstraints()
          Return a IO which can be used to remove constraints specified in RDF from the database.
 
Methods inherited from interface com.complexible.stardog.api.Connection
add, admin, as, ask, ask, begin, close, commit, export, get, graph, graph, isOpen, namespaces, reasoning, remove, rollback, select, select, size, update, update
 
Methods inherited from interface com.complexible.stardog.icv.ICValidator
addConstraint, clearConstraints, convertConstraint, convertConstraint, getConstraints, getViolationBindings, getViolationBindings, isValid, isValid, removeConstraint
 

Method Detail

addConstraints

IO addConstraints()
                  throws StardogException
Return an IO which can add a constraint ontology specified in RDF to the database. Specifying the context in the IO object has no effect, you cannot put the integrity constraints into a specific named graph in the database.

Returns:
an IO to use for adding the constraints
Throws:
StardogException - a handle to IO could not be obtained to add constraints

removeConstraints

IO removeConstraints()
                     throws StardogException
Return a IO which can be used to remove constraints specified in RDF from the database. Specifying the context in the IO object has no effect, you cannot remove the integrity constraints from a specific named graph in the database.

Returns:
an IO to use for removing constraints
Throws:
StardogException - a handle to the IO could not be obtained to remove constraints

explain

StardogExplainer explain(Constraint... theConstraints)
                         throws StardogException
Returns an explainer that can be used to explain the violation for given constraints. If no constraints are given then all the current constraints in the database are used.

Throws:
StardogException
